column4: can someone help me retrieve files from a hard drive using ubuntu live cd?
what os in on the harddrive
I'm not sure what file system
all I see in computer - file browser is "/boot" "cdrom" "filesystem" and my usbflash key
it shows the same as I just told you but it also lists "desktop" "trash" and documents music etc
it will say something like "45gb volume", or something along those lines, most likely
there is nothing like that, in the places pane
use mount
so, mount -t /dev/sda
I'm not command prompt savvy so I dont know what type
lemme check that okay? ill brb
sorry if you have already done this, what is listed in the line of /dev/sda if you fdisk -ls
there are two sections when I do sudo fdisk -l the first one says Disk /dev/sda: 20GB and sector info etc
the secont section says Device Boot Start End ID System etc
yeah under system it says linux
well if you think that it is ext3
I'll post a screenshot to zoho notebook so you can see what it says
i dont have a gui, i cant open images
i found the auto command
did you see the command up there ^
sudo mount -t autofs /dev/sda1 /media/mountusb -o force
I ran both of those commands and I did find the directory it created but it doesn't seem to have mounted the hard drive to that path
you may need to check that the harddrive is infact at /dev/sda, it might be sdb or hda or any other things
